ca.uqac.lif.textidote.cleaning

Class TextCleaner

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.textidote.cleaning.TextCleaner
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CompositeCleaner, LatexCleaner, MarkdownCleaner, ReplacementCleaner

    public abstract class TextCleaner
extends java.lang.Object
    Removes markup from a text file. A text cleaner can perform two kinds of "cleanup" on a text file:
    • A full cleanup that removes all markup. Portions of the file that do not contain meaningful text (for example, LaTeX equations) may also be removed. As a rule, do not consider the output string as a completely faithful clear-text rendition of the original document.
    • A cleanup that only removes blocks of text identified as comments. What a "comment" means depends on the markup language, and some languages may not have comments at all.
    Author:
    Sylvain Hall√©

      abstract AnnotatedString cleanComments(AnnotatedString s)
      Removes portions of the string indentified as comments, but keeps all other markup.
      abstract java.util.List<java.lang.String> getInnerFiles()
      Returns the list of inner files included in the file to be cleaned.

    • Method Detail

      • clean

        public abstract AnnotatedString clean(AnnotatedString s)
                               throws TextCleanerException
        Removes markup from a string.
        Parameters:
        s - The original string. Note that this string can be modified by the method.
        Returns:
        The new string. Whether this object is a copy of s or s itself is left undefined.
        Throws:
        TextCleanerException - If a problem occurs when cleaning

      • cleanComments

        public abstract AnnotatedString cleanComments(AnnotatedString s)
                                       throws TextCleanerException
        Removes portions of the string indentified as comments, but keeps all other markup.
        Parameters:
        s - The original string. Note that this string can be modified by the method.
        Returns:
        The new string. Whether this object is a copy of s or s itself is left undefined.
        Throws:
        TextCleanerException - If a problem occurs when cleaning

      • getInnerFiles

        public abstract java.util.List<java.lang.String> getInnerFiles()
        Returns the list of inner files included in the file to be cleaned. Currently, this only has a meaning for cleaners based on LaTeX, which has include and input instructions. This result will be non-empty only after clean() has been called.
        Returns:
        The list of filenames
